overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research related to disinformation, computational social science, and coordinated online behavior. LinkedIn has the highest follower count, while Bluesky and LinkedIn content appear to generate the most engagement per post.

contentThemes.description: Posts related to research projects, publications, and methodologies in computational social science.
Content focused on detecting, analyzing, and mitigating disinformation and coordinated inauthentic behavior online.
Posts advertising research positions, grants, and opportunities for students and postdoctoral researchers.

recommendations: Share cross-platform promotions: Promote content from one platform on the others to increase visibility.
Increase posting frequency on Mastodon: Aim for more consistent posting to engage the audience there.
Engage in more discussions: Actively participate in conversations and respond to comments to foster a stronger community.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows strong engagement with research announcements and conference presentations, suggesting a highly relevant audience for academic content.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon has a dedicated audience interested in algorithm development and methodological discussions, but engagement is relatively lower than other platforms.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn performs best for professional announcements like grants, hiring, and general research updates, indicating a professional network focus.
